title: MySQLMAKEDATE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLMAKEDATE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Create and return a date based on  a year and a number of days value:
SELECT MAKEDATE(2017, 3);

Definition and Usage
The MAKEDATE() function creates and returns a date based on a year and a 
number of days value.
Syntax
MAKEDATE(
year
,
day
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
year
Required. A year (4-digits)
day
Required. A number that indicates the day of the year
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Create and return a date based on  a year and a number of days value:
SELECT MAKEDATE(2017, 175);

Example
Create and return a date based on  a year and a number of days value:
SELECT MAKEDATE(2017, 100);

Example
Create and return a date based on  a year and a number of days value:
SELECT MAKEDATE(2017, 366);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLMAKEDATE()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLMAKEDATE()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLMAKEDATE()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
